result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristy L Matti

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Defendant's Motion To Reschedule Final Pretrial

Defendant Kristy L Matti in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Kristy L Matti.  Attorney Navjot Hira in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court canceled the stayed bench warrant based on defendant's appearance in court.  Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 15.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court will be down 8/12/2022 and unable to hear this case.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case rescheduled for 9/1/2022 at 8:30 am for calendar call.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Status Conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Defendant's Zoom Request

Defendant Kristy L Matti in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Kristy L Matti in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Kristy L Matti in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kristy L Matti appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  
This hearing may be streamed live through DACAST at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
